intro: Stachygynandrum ciliare, commonly known as the silky sedge, is a flowering plant species native to parts of Asia, particularly China and Japan. It is a member of the Cyperaceae family, which includes grass-like plants known as sedges. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and small, triangular leaves that are often covered in fine, silky hairs. It produces spikelets that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers, typical of many sedges. Stachygynandrum ciliare is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or wetlands.
